item.title: Apple to scan U.S. iPhones for images of child sexual abuse
item.description: Apple unveiled plans to scan U.S. iPhones for images of child sexual abuse, drawing applause from child protection groups but raising concern among some security researchers that the system could be misused, including by governments looking to surveil their citizens.
item.author: (By FRANK BAJAK and BARBARA ORTUTAY)

item.title: In internal memo, Apple addresses concerns around new Photo scanning features, doubles down on the need to protect children
item.description: Apple yesterday officially announced a range of new features coming later this year, dubbed Expanded Protections for Children. The new features include protections for sensitive images in iMessage, iCloud Photo scanning for child sexual abuse material (CSAM) content, and new knowledge for Siri and Search. In an internal memo distributed to the teams that worked […]
item.author: (Chance Miller)

item.title: Vehicles Are Still Firmly in Control of City Streets
item.description: Surveys show Americans want more walkable cities and bike riding continues to grow. Yet urban streets are still designed and used like highways. Change is happening, but at a very slow pace, says urban expert Jeff Speck.
item.author: (https://www.governing.com/jake-blumgart)

item.title: A Black Bear Visits Dave's Garage! Survivors tell their stories.
item.description: A black bear has been eating my garbage. While I eagerly await new trash bins from Waste Management, it keeps coming back to snack!DO NOT APPROACH BEARS. Duh.
item.author:
(Dave's Garage

item.title: The Problem with Perceptual Hashes
item.description: Apple just announced that they will use “perceptual hashing” to detect illegal photos on iPhones. I have some experience to share on this technology.
